title: Painbrush BRN-Z
paragraphs: The Painbrush BRN-Z is a main weapon in Splatoon 3. It is a Barazushi-branded variant of the Painbrush.

The Painbrush BRN-Z looks similar to the Painbrush, however it has dark grey bristles and a bronze composition with traces of characteristic green copper patina. Whitish text is stamped under the joint of the swiveling brush head in a hyphenated format, possibly resembling a serial number. A packet resembling a field ration packet stamped with Barazushi's logo is attached to the side of the weapon, and the small ring separating the handle from the rest of the weapon is a dark green. This small ring never changes color to match the user's ink, unlike the original Painbrush.
The Painbrush BRN-Z was added as part of the Splatlands Collection on 12 June 2025. It comes with the Splash Wall sub and Trizooka special weapon.

The Painbrush BRN-Z from Barazushi features a stunning bronze design, but this is not a weapon that's willing to accept third place! With the Splash Wall sub weapon to stake out a safe spot and the Trizooka special to add range and power, this loadout is well-balanced and reliable. If you can patiently wait for the right moment to turn the tables all at once, I'd recommend that you give this set a try!
The suffix "BRN-Z" is a stylized spelling of the word bronze, referencing the weapon's design.

- The Painbrush BRN-Z is a middleweight weapon.
- The matchmaking range is 13.1. The game's matchmaking system looks at a team's average matchmaking range value, and matches them against a team with a similar average.
- Ink consumption per second while sliding is 10.8%.
- While sliding, the player's movement speed is set to 0.18 units per frame.
- After sliding, there is a 20 frame second cooldown before the ink tank starts refilling.
- Hitting an opponent while sliding deals 30 damage.
- While sliding, the Painbrush BRN-Z leaves an ink trail that is 2.6 units wide.
- The ink consumption of 4.8% allows players to attack 20 times before needing to refill the ink supply.
- When attacking, it takes 23 frames to start swinging the brush.
- The weapon can be swung every 13 frames (4.62 times per second).
- When attacking while moving, the player's movement speed is set to 0.024 units per frame.
- After swinging, there is a 50 frame cooldown before the ink tank starts refilling.
- Attacks have a base damage of 60.

- For normal attacks, ink loses damage based on distance traveled. Ink starts losing damage at 5.0 units and stops losing damage at 13.0 units. The minimum damage before time-based falloff is applied is 31.

- If a glob of ink is in the air for more than 24 frames after being flung, it loses damage each frame until frame 45, at which point it will deal 50% of its original damage. Thus, the minimum damage that can be dealt per glob is is 15.5.
- Damage does not change based on the angle of the ink.
- ▼ Points to fill special gauge: 180 → 190.
